subject: Re: How to test protected and private methods/ fields?

messageBody:
Q. Should you test protected/private methods, or look at
protected/private members?

A. Yes. In XP, the goal of Unit Testing is to "test anything that
could possibly break." If that means looking inside the class then
do it. White-box testing is a very efficient way to "test anything
that could possibly break"


Q. Ok, how do you test protected/private methods?

A. For protected members, you have two options. The first option is
to have your tests in the same package, so they would have access.
The second option is to use Java's reflection to make the protected
(or private) member public.

I think JUnitX has code to provide access. I have also used
a "PrivilegedAccess" utility class to gain access. I'll see if we
can get that code posted.


- Greg Houston
